column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: ANZ's Mindset 2030 learning program supports its employees in better understanding its environmental sustainability strategy, research and publications and how ANZ engages with customers in line with its climate change commitment. This year, ANZ added new modules to the learning program, covering ESG topics such as financial well-being and risk management.
column20: Mindset 2030, environmental sustainability strategy, ESG topic

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Since launching the Executive Leadership Series last year, ANZ has delivered two modules targeted to senior leadership focusing on topics related to its strategy. The module on performance and culture was attended by over 70% of senior leadership, with around 86% of attendees indicating it helped improve their leadership approach.
column20: Executive Leadership Series, senior leadership, performance, culture

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: ANZ launched the 1% Better program this year to support its people in being aware of their cultural behaviours and build the desired habits and skills to demonstrate these daily. Over 5,000 participants have attended the modules, with more than 90% indicating they could better demonstrate ANZ's behaviours.
column20: 1% Better Program, cultural behaviour, desired habit

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: The newly launched LEAD@ANZ program is designed to empower people leaders across the organisation and equip them with the skills and confidence to be an exceptional leader. Topics covered include what it takes to be a great leader and how to bring ANZ's purpose and strategy to life.
column20: LEAD@ANZ, people leader, purpose, strategy

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
column13: ANZ's refreshed 2023-2025 Accessibility and Inclusion Plan is registered with the Australian Human Rights Commission. The Plan includes a refined set of obligations for ANZ to continue to build a more accessible bank for its customers, employees and the community. Importantly, the Plan now extends to New Zealand for the first time.
column20: Accessibility and Inclusion Plan, Australian Human Rights Commission, accessible bank

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: ANZ implemented a Cultural Learning Strategy designed to improve the cultural competency of Australia-based non-Indigenous employees to meet the needs of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander customers, employees and community partners.
column20: Cultural Learning Strategy, cultural competency, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander customer

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: ANZ developed an enterprise Women in Leadership (WIL) Action Plan, which focuses on increasing the representation of WIL and 'building the pipeline'. The Plan includes a sustained focus on prioritised segments such as Institutional and Technology, which have large leadership populations Ã¢ÂÂ a higher proportion of which are men.
column20: Women in Leadership Action Plan, Institutional and Technology, leadership population

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: ANZ developed an enterprise Sponsorship Playbook to guide groups across the bank looking to run a sponsorship program and completed a stocktake of its people policies, processes and practices to identify opportunities for improvement. Some adjustments ANZ is making include improving its exit interview process and providing additional guidance for hiring managers on inclusive recruitment.
column20: Sponsorship Playbook, sponsorship program, interview process

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: ANZ's ForWARD gender equity network, in collaboration with Pride, hosted a virtual panel event on "None of the Above: Life Isn't Binary" for this year's International Non-Binary People's Day to celebrate the non-binary community. In addition to celebrating other important days on the diversity and inclusion calendar, an employee networks marketplace was held in celebration of International Women's Day to promote awareness of the events, resources and different support systems the networks make available to their members across the bank globally.
column20: ForWARD, Pride, Non-Binary People's Day

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: ANZ's Abilities Network was a finalist in the 'Disability Employee Network of the Year' category of the annual Disability Confidence Awards run by the Australian Network on Disability, recognising the significant work done to create a more accessible bank.
column20: Abilities Network, Disability Confidence Awards, Australian Network on Disability

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column13: The Fitted for Work (FFW) is an Australian-based not-for-profit organisation that supports female-identifying unemployed customers in improving their employment prospects by developing a rÃÂ©sumÃÂ©, writing a cover letter, and providing appropriate work clothes. This year, 340 hardship customers looking for work were referred to FFW. Since inception, approximately 25% of referred customers who have completed the FFW program have found employment.
column20: Fitted for Work, employment prospects, hardship customer

column6: Incidents of discrimination and corrective actions taken

column4: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
column6: Operations and suppliers in which the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk
column13: Contracted suppliers, including subcontracted suppliers, are screened as part of Group Procurement's ongoing supplier due diligence using a third-party tool to assess performance against 28 ESG issues. These checks identified potential issues in 12 instances. ANZ requested further details from the suppliers to determine whether they had adequate measures to resolve the identified issue.
column20: Supplier due diligence, contracted supplier, ESG issue

column6: Operations and suppliers at significant risk for incidents of child labor
column13: ANZ's Land Acquisition Position Statement outlines its support for customers who are implementing appropriate standards for land acquisition and resettlement, including engaging their engagement with the community and other key stakeholders.
column20: Land Acquisition Position Statement, customer, land acquisition

column6: Operations and suppliers ar significant risk for incidents of forced or compulsory labor
column13: ANZ's Human Rights Grievance Mechanism is available to people and communities who believe their human rights have been impacted by ANZ's Institutional or Corporate lending customers. For a grievance to be accepted into the Mechanism, the customer must consent to both ANZ disclosing the existence of a current or former lending relationship to the Affected People and participating in the Mechanism.
column20: Human Rights Grievance Mechanism, human rights, lending relationship

column6: Security personnel trained in human rights policies or procedures
column13: ANZ's Customer Advocate team participates in Broome Circle's 'Help us understand your way' roundtable, which brings together community sector groups, financial counsellors, regulators, essential service providers and banks. The focus of the roundtable is to discuss barriers faced by residents living in remote communities in Western Australia's Kimberley region and to collaborate on ways to improve accessibility and outcomes for this Group.
column20: Broome Circle, community sector group, remote community

column6: Incidents of violations involving rights of indigenous peoples
column8: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Customer Support Line
column13: ANZ recognises Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander customers, particularly those living in remote communities, may experience barriers to banking and financial inclusion. ANZ launched the Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Customer Support Line, which commenced operating as a dedicated team in August this year. If required, overflow calls are taken by trained bankers across the Customer Contact Centre.
column20: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Customer Support Line, remote community, trained banker

column6: Operations that have been subject to human rights reviews or impacts assessments
Employee training on human rights policies or procedures
column13: ANZ provided ongoing training to build cultural capability and awareness for staff working on its dedicated Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Customer Support Line and in the branch.
column20: Ongoing training, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Customer Support Line, cultural capability

column6: Significant investment agreements and contracts that include human rights clauses or that underwent human rights screening
column13: ANZ updated its Statement of Referee form, which lists alternative forms of acceptable identification for customers who do not have conventional forms of identification to support more accessible banking. The form now also includes financial counsellors, staff at Services Australia and community lawyers as referees.
column20: Statement of Referee form, accessible banking, financial counsellor

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: This year, ANZ supported the launch of a new project to market by specialist affordable housing fund manager Super Housing Partnership (SHP) and its venture partner, Assemble. SHP provides institutional investors access to equity investments in new build-to-rent housing projects focusing on social and affordable housing in Australia.
column20: Super Housing Partnership, housing fund manager, institutional investor

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: ANZ funded a $57 million facility to support the Conscious Investment Management Group's affordable housing investment fund in a partnership with Housing First to provide 307 apartments. It includes a 10-year subsidy from the Victorian government, demonstrating the finance sector's role when the funding gap is bridged.
column20: Conscious Investment Management Group, housing investment fund, Housing First

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: ANZ is a leading financier with more than $300 million of investment in the Specialist Disability Accommodation (SDA) sector since 2018, which finances groups, such as MySas and Synergis, that have developed purpose-built accommodation for up to 530 SDA participants.
column20: Specialist Disability Accommodation, MySas, Synergis

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: ANZ supports expanding Assemble's build-to-rent-to-own (BTRTO) model with three projects underway or completed, including constructing a 199-apartment BTRTO project in Kensington, Victoria. The model seeks to overcome two major housing market hurdles: security of tenure and the deposit gap.
column20: BTRTO model, apartment, housing market

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Anika Legal is a free online legal service that provides reliable legal advice for renters to take control of their living arrangements. The ANZ Community Foundation provided a grant of $20,000 to support people transitioning from homelessness into housing to understand tenant rights.
column20: Anika Legal, online legal service, legal advice

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: YWCA is a non-profit organisation providing safe and affordable accommodation and services to support women and gender-diverse people experiencing homelessness, family violence or other crises. The ANZ Community Foundation provided a grant of $23,500 to upgrade emergency accommodation for youth experiencing homelessness.
column20: YWCA, accommodation, woman

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: MoneyMinded is ANZ's flagship financial education program, supporting lower-income adults in building their financial skills, knowledge, and confidence. Community organisations in Australia and New Zealand deliver the program. In addition, this year, MoneyMinded was delivered in 14 markets across Asia and the Pacific region by community organisations and ANZ employees.
column20: MoneyMinded, financial education, financial skill

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: In 2016, ANZ introduced an extension of MoneyMinded designed specifically for people in the community experiencing family violence. Berry Street has been training family violence specialists in the enhanced MoneyMinded program Ã¢ÂÂ including a new range of visual resources, prompt cards, animations, and interactive handouts, supporting community professionals to talk about financial abuse with their clients in accessible ways.
column20: Berry Street, MoneyMinded, family violence

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Since 2010, MoneyMinded has been delivered across the Asia Pacific region, including in Fiji, where ANZ and Fiji Rugby Union (FRU) have formalised a new partnership to help players, FRU staff and members improve their money skills, knowledge, and confidence. According to ANZ Fiji Country Head Rabih Yazbek, Rugby Union players are some of Fiji's most important role models.
column20: Fiji Rugby Union, MoneyMinded, money skill

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: Community Colleges NZ (Comcol) is one of ANZ Bank New Zealand's main MoneyMinded delivery partners. With five locations across the South Island, Comcol has over 40 years of experience providing quality, hands-on learning and practical training to rangatahi (youth). Services include youth support, vocational training and preparation for employment.
column20: Community Colleges NZ, MoneyMinded, vocational training
